section.title: Silent Generation of Unique Ids
section.para: Internally, in JHotDraw, a "Figure" is referenced using the opaque "reference type" functionality of the Java language, which guarantees that every figure can be unambiguosly referenced.
The user may assign a textual "id" to a figure.
While a user edits a Drawing, it is not always guaranteed that the user assigned "id" is unique.
However a user may want to perform an action, that requires a unique id.
Actions that require a unique id:
When a user performs such an action, JHotDraw will silently replace non-unique ids with unique ids.
Replacement keeps the first non-unique id, and adds a suffix "_" followed by an integral number to each subsequent non-unique ids.
